name: Expense Tracker
comment: My most recent project, and my favorite. This one felt more polished than my previous ones, I took this on to build on the foundational database and software development concepts taught in University.
description: A command-line Java app equipped with user authentication, a MySQL database and JUnit tests.

name: Compiler Front End
comment: This was a course project that introduced me to Python and challenged me to creatively solve problems using code. I'm especially proud of how I came up with the solution of using a stack data structure to implement error recovery in the parser
description: A scanner and parser that tokenize and parse txt files based on a JSON-like grammar.

name: Solar System Simulator (Team Project)
comment: This project was created in collaboration with four other students as part of the NASA SpaceApps 2024 Hackathon. It was my first hackathon and a great learning experience in team development.
description: An interactive application developed for NASA SpaceApps 2024, allowing users to explore the dynamics of our solar system through realistic gravitational simulations.

name: Dal CS Review Site
comment: This project built on the MERN basics I learned, teaching me about how database models relationships work in a real-world scenario
description: A MERN stack web app with user authentication that displays Dalhousie CS courses, allowing users to create reviews.

name: CLI Chess
comment: After my first year studies, I was eager to use OOP fundamentals to tackle a logic-intensive problem. Even though coding chess is very unoriginal, I'm really proud of this one because I did it all from scratch without using any external resources
description: A command line version of Chess using Java Object-Oriented Principles.

name: Inventory Manager
comment: This project was my first step into the world of fullstack development!
description: A MERN stack web app that performs CRUD operations on a fictitious inventory of products.
